msContents.summary: Tax register, recording day by day the collection of money taxes.

msItemStruct.note: Pub. status: Recto; Verso is Blank
+ P.Cair. Inv. 57187; P.Iand. VII, 141; P.Mich. Inv. 2830; 4171; 4910

condition.ab: Regularly cut at the left and top sides. The right hand side is regularly cut in two cuts. There are several lacunae at the column, but mainly they are at the middle and the very end of the column as a result of two folds. The column is damaged at the bottom, yet some letters are survived at the line before the last, and a head of letter can be seen at the last line. No Restoration is needed. (MA)

handDesc.p: Written in a quick but clear cursive. The scribe separated a new entry from the preceding one by underlining the name of the taxpayer. Traces of ink can bee seen at the edge of the upper part of the papyrus.

origin.origPlace: Karanis, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt
origin.persName: Thasis, daughter of Petheus (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 174)
Mysthes, son Xistis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 189)
Isidoros, son of Mysthes, grandson of Isidoros, mother Thasis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 179)
Hatres, son of Apollonios (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 156)
Tapetheus, daughter of Pasoknopaios (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 236)
Chairemon, son of Pateis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 247)
Kastor, son of Onnophris, grandson of Petheus, mother Tapetheus (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 181)
Ammonous, daughter of Didymos (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 151)
Satabous, alias Kommon, son of Onnophris, grandson of Satabous, mother Ptolema (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 226)
Pasion, the brother, the same mother (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 198)
Kommon, son of Onnophris (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 183)
Lucius Julius Germanos (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 185)
Gaius Julius Paniskianos (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 159)

provenance.p: Karanis, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.
